Class CardList

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Deck, Hand

    public class CardList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is used to represent a list of cards.
    Author:
    Kenneth Wong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Returns true if this list contains no cards.

      Prints the cards in this list to the console.

      Removes all cards from this list.

        public CardList()

    • Method Detail

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card card)
        Appends the specified card to the end of this list.
        Parameters:
        card - the card to be appended to this list

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int i)
        Returns the card at the specified position in this list.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the card to returned
        Returns:
        the card at the specified position in this list, or null if the index is invalid

      • removeCard

        public Card removeCard(int i)
        Removes the card at the specified position in this list. Shifts any subsequent cards to the left (subtracts one from their indices).
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the card to be removed
        Returns:
        the card that is removed from the list, or null if the index is invalid

      • removeCard

        public boolean removeCard(Card card)
        Removes the first occurrence of the specified card from this list, if it is present. If the list does not contain the card, it remains unchanged. Returns true if this list contained the specified card (or equivalently, if this list changed as a result of the call).
        Parameters:
        card - the card to be removed from this list, if presents
        Returns:
        true if this list contained the specified card; otherwise false

      • removeAllCards

        public void removeAllCards()
        Removes all cards from this list.

      • setCard

        public Card setCard(int i,
                    Card card)
        Replaces the card at the specified position in this list with the specified card.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the card to be replaced
        card - the card to be stored at the specified position
        Returns:
        the card previously stored at the specified position, or null if the index is invalid

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Card card)
        Returns true if this list contains the specified card.
        Parameters:
        card - the card whose presence in this list is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if this list contains the specified card; otherwise false

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this list contains no cards.
        Returns:
        true if this list contains no cards; otherwise false

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Sorts this list according to the order of the cards.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of cards in this list.
        Returns:
        the number of cards in this list

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints the cards in this list to the console. Equivalent to calling print(true, false);

      • print

        public void print(boolean printFront,
                  boolean printIndex)
        Prints the cards in this list to the console.
        Parameters:
        printFront - a boolean value specifying whether to print the face (true) or the black (false) of the cards
        printIndex - a boolean value specifying whether to print the index in front of each card

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the cards in the list
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the cards in the list
